channel.title: Cannabis resin?
channel.description:
So yesterday me and 2 friends got an 8th, it was pretty dry.
I had a few pipe hits but wasn't feeling much.
I was ripping/crushing it up (no grinder:() to go into a few 1 skin blunts and when I had finished I had a load of green sticky shit on my finger tips, which took ages to get off, could this have gotten me high? I was very stoned compared to the other 2 friends of mine after a blunt or 2 who had the same amount f cannabis as I did.
My question: can the resin on my hands make me higher? If so I'll be crushing the herb up again :p

item.title: Cannabis resin?
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“super_, post:13, topic:397369”]the trichomes i’ve heard as crystals/hairs or some portmanteau like crystal hairs :p[/quote]I could see why from the picture provided, but just not something I had ever considered.

As for a topical solution, the only way that the cannabinoids could possibly become active topically is if the plant was soaked in alcohol or turned into a balm/lotion. However, the solution would aid medically for the specific area, it has no effect on your brain and there is no high. I’d just say you got nicely toasted then thought “OMFG IT WAS MY HANDS MENG”

Read full topic

item.title: Cannabis resin?
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

the trichomes i’ve heard as crystals/hairs or some portmanteau like crystal hairs

Read full topic

item.title: Cannabis resin?
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

I’ve never heard of the term “hairs” being used for trichomes, however I have heard the term used to describe the pollen collecting part of a female marijuana plant.

As for resin, although it is technically the same resin which is referenced in “resin-production” through a plants growth cycle (ie. trichomes) it is most often referred to (atleast around here) as the black “resin” found in for example a pipe, or along the tip of a joint or in a heavily used bong. This black, tar like substance will infact get you high, but is also famed for its common residual effects of short lasting high and headache.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannabis resin?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

HOLY SHIT, APPARENTLY SUPER DOESN’T KNOW EVERYTHING!

item.title: Cannabis resin?
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:8, topic:397369”][quote author=super_ link=topic=494513.msg3617843#msg3617843 date=1307135409]
the little crystals look like hairs… like pwnd says, it makes it look fuzzy

[/quote]

Yeah they don’t look like that to the human eye though, and I think chrisn was just pointing out that trichomes are not “colloquially known as hairs.”

What is colloquially known as hairs on marijuana, are the larger brown/yellow/orange/red hairs found on the plant and/or buds.
(not my pic)
[/quote]
oh right, i’ve heard both called hairs

Read full topic

item.title: Cannabis resin?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“super_, post:7, topic:397369”]the little crystals look like hairs… like pwnd says, it makes it look fuzzy
http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/e8/Trichomes_Close_Cannabis.jpg[/quote]

Yeah they don’t look like that to the human eye though, and I think chrisn was just pointing out that trichomes are not “colloquially known as hairs.”

What is colloquially known as hairs on marijuana, are the larger brown/yellow/orange/red hairs found on the plant and/or buds.
(not my pic)

item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:5, topic:397369”]The trichomes aren’t the hairs but rather the little crystals on the plant.[/quote]Which, on good weed, give it the illusion of lookin’ fuzzy ;D

item.title: Cannabis resin?
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

duh

scrape the res off your fingers and smoke it.

super_:

The only resin I know of is that which is commonly seen on trichomes, also colloquially known as “hairs.” The resin itself is where the majority of the THC is stored, which is the main psychoactive cannibinoid what causes the perceived high. Those who cultivate their own marijuana attempt to pick a “harvest” time such that trichome development has peaked and therefore THC production has maximized, attempting to create an optimal recipe for recreational usage. The resin being on your hands probably would have had no effect, as THC is not efficiently absorbed through the skin, but diffused in through the lungs.

The trichomes aren’t the hairs but rather the little crystals on the plant.

Read full topic
